messages.content: You need to judge whether there is Stiction by the image. The image has PV(blue line) and OP(orange line) on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. PV stands for process variable and OP stands for controller output. Typical feature of Stiction: When OP changes, PV does not respond immediately but remains at its original level. Once OP exceeds a certain threshold, PV suddenly jumps.
<image>This is PV&OP-t graph. Is there stiction?
Yes, there is stiction in this control loop.
Why, how do you judge?
The change of PV lags behind that of OP, indicating that there is stiction in the system.

You need to judge whether there is Stiction by the image. The image has PV on the y-axis and OP on the x-axis. PV stands for process variable and OP stands for controller output. The typical feature of Stiction is hysteresis loop trajectory
<image>This is PV-OP graph. Is there stiction?
Yes, there is stiction in this control loop.
Why, how do you judge?
In the PV-OP diagram, a typical loop trajectory is shown, and there is no positive linear relationship, indicating the existence of stiction.

You need to determine whether stiction is present based on the image. The graph shows PV (blue line) and OP (orange line) on the y-axis, with time displayed on the x-axis. PV represents the process variable, and OP stands for the controller's output. A typical sign of stiction is that the PV change follows the OP change with a delay.
<image>This is the PV&OP-time graph. Can you detect stiction?
No, stiction is not present in this control loop.
Why, how do you reach this conclusion?
PV and OP are changing in opposite directions, which does not align with the characteristics of stiction.

You need to assess whether stiction is present based on the image. The graph shows PV on the y-axis and OP on the x-axis. PV refers to the process variable, and OP is the controller output. A defining feature of stiction is the trajectory of the loop.
<image>This is the PV-OP graph. Can you determine if there is stiction?
No, there is no stiction in this control loop.
Why, how do you judge?
In the PV-OP diagram, there is no loop trajectory. It does not meet the characteristics of stiction.
